  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fleet Manager (Lagride)",
  "description": "CIG Motors Company Limited is one of the African subsidiaries of Choice International Group. We are the exclusive premiere representative of leading Chinese automotive giants, including GAC Motors, JMC Motors, Dongfeng Motors, FAW Group, and Wuling Motors, within the Nigeria and Africa market.

CIG have consistently expanded our market presence nationwide through strategic partnerships and alliances, delivering a portfolio of high-quality and premium vehicles into the African market. We prioritize customer satisfaction and strive to exceed expectations. Our dedication to quality, innovation, and growth remains unwavering as we continue to shape the automotive industry landscape in Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Manager (Lagride)

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Victoria Island,&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Fleet Manager is responsible for leading the planning, coordination, and execution of fleet-related activities, ensuring the availability, safety, and performance of the vehicle fleet comprising both internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs).
	This role involves supervising the driver workforce, optimizing fleet utilization, overseeing maintenance schedules, and supporting the company&rsquo;s mobility goals through data-driven operational decisions.
	The ideal candidate will use data-driven insights, cross-functional coordination, and leadership skills to manage fleet logistics and support the company&rsquo;s strategic growth in Lagos and beyond.


Key Responsibilities
Fleet Operations:


	Oversee day-to-day operations of Lagride&rsquo;s vehicle fleet, including ICE (internal combustion engine) and electric vehicles.
	Ensure effective allocation, deployment, and rotation of vehicles based on real-time demand.
	Develop and execute operational SOPs for fleet movement, servicing, documentation, and recovery.
	Monitor EV battery performance, charging cycles, and schedule charging activities to minimize downtime.
	Lead scaling of fleet operations into new service areas and ensure readiness of vehicles and infrastructure.


Driver &amp; Vehicle Oversight:


	Supervise a large network of drivers and field agents to ensure optimal vehicle handling, safety, and customer service.
	Liaise with HR and Training teams to schedule onboarding, retraining, and license renewals for drivers.
	Enforce compliance with driving standards, Lagride&rsquo;s service policies, and state regulatory requirements.
	Review incident and accident reports; liaise with insurance, admin, and legal teams for resolution.


Maintenance &amp; Downtime Management:


	Coordinate preventive and corrective vehicle maintenance, leveraging both internal workshops and vendor networks.
	Ensure all vehicles are serviced and roadworthy with valid papers (insurance, road worthiness, registration).
	Deploy replacement vehicles swiftly in case of breakdowns and follow up until the original is returned to the fleet.
	Oversee fueling and EV charging operations, ensuring accountability and cost-efficiency.


Reporting &amp; Performance Management:


	Generate reports on:
	
		Fleet utilization
		Vehicle downtime
		Driver performance metrics
		Fuel and energy consumption
		Maintenance costs
	
	
	Use fleet management software and dashboards to identify trends and optimize operational decisions


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Transport Management, Engineering, Logistics, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in fleet operations, ideally within a tech-enabled transport or ride-hailing company.
	Strong knowledge of both ICE vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs), including servicing and maintenance.
	Excellent leadership and team coordination skills.
	Hands-on experience with fleet management systems, GPS tracking, and data analysis tools.
	Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage operations in a fast-paced environment.
	Good written and verbal communication skills.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Fleet Manager (Lagride)

Job Location:  Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Fleet Manager is responsible for leading the planning, coordination, and execution of fleet-related activities, ensuring the availability, safety, and performance of the vehicle fleet comprising both internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs).
	This role involves supervising the driver workforce, optimizing fleet utilization, overseeing maintenance schedules, and supporting the company’s mobility goals through data-driven operational decisions.
	The ideal candidate will use data-driven insights, cross-functional coordination, and leadership skills to manage fleet logistics and support the company’s strategic growth in Lagos and beyond.


Key Responsibilities
Fleet Operations:


	Oversee day-to-day operations of Lagride’s vehicle fleet, including ICE (internal combustion engine) and electric vehicles.
	Ensure effective allocation, deployment, and rotation of vehicles based on real-time demand.
	Develop and execute operational SOPs for fleet movement, servicing, documentation, and recovery.
	Monitor EV battery performance, charging cycles, and schedule charging activities to minimize downtime.
	Lead scaling of fleet operations into new service areas and ensure readiness of vehicles and infrastructure.


Driver & Vehicle Oversight:


	Supervise a large network of drivers and field agents to ensure optimal vehicle handling, safety, and customer service.
	Liaise with HR and Training teams to schedule onboarding, retraining, and license renewals for drivers.
	Enforce compliance with driving standards, Lagride’s service policies, and state regulatory requirements.
	Review incident and accident reports; liaise with insurance, admin, and legal teams for resolution.


Maintenance & Downtime Management:


	Coordinate preventive and corrective vehicle maintenance, leveraging both internal workshops and vendor networks.
	Ensure all vehicles are serviced and roadworthy with valid papers (insurance, road worthiness, registration).
	Deploy replacement vehicles swiftly in case of breakdowns and follow up until the original is returned to the fleet.
	Oversee fueling and EV charging operations, ensuring accountability and cost-efficiency.

	Generate reports on:
	
		Fleet utilization
		Vehicle downtime

	Minimum of 5 years of experience in fleet operations, ideally within a tech-enabled transport or ride-hailing company.
	Strong knowledge of both ICE vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs), including servicing and maintenance.
	Excellent leadership and team coordination skills.
	Hands-on experience with fleet management systems, GPS tracking, and data analysis tools.
	Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage operations in a fast-paced environment.
	Good written and verbal communication skills.

With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Category Buyer

Job Location: Lagos

Your Mission
     

            
    




	You will be the owner of the assortment we offer to our customers: from analyzing market trends and defining listings to prospecting suppliers, and negotiating commercial conditions.


The Journey


	Be the owner and specialist of assigned categories, being able to move the needle and see the impact of your work on the business by managing the MFCs assortment from end to end.
	Your main KPIs will be Category Add-to-Cart, Average Order Value, and Gross Margin.
	Define the assortment strategy, identify opportunities of improvement in listings and margin, and implement them.
	Manage vendor relationships, with a special focus on the top ones - manage supplier/partner contracts, manage day-to-day relationships, and negotiate and secure marketing funds per the market requirements and company needs.
	Review contract terms and conditions ensuring that they are as favorable to the business interests as possible, minimize risk, and are in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures (with support from the Commercial Manager and legal department)
	Oversee UX and Pricing
	Lead, coach, and develop talented team members.
	You will work hand in hand with the Ads team in defining and implementing marketing campaigns inside the store.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


	At least 5 years of experience in Retail as a category manager or category buyer.
	Strong negotiation skills; expert understanding of terms, conditions, and contracting techniques for managing risk.
	Previous experience in leading teams.
	Stakeholder management: both internally and externally.
	Willingness to roll up sleeves to get things done
	Comfortable working in a fast-changing, high-growth, and high-performance start-up with a fast pace
	Fluent in English. Additional language skills are a plus.


Benefits


	An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
	Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
	Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
	Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
	Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
	Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
	Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
	Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Additional Information


	Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture.
	We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds.
	This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU.
	We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard. 
	Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

The company was founded on a mission to build a scalable agribusiness to add value to the local fruit value chain, produced, package and distribute locally made snacks that could sit on any shelf in the world!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day implementation and compliance to all product and process specifications, as well as food and environmental safety.

	Ensure all quality procedures for fruit washing and storage are observed.
	Check the peeling and cutting quality, and complete the quality control sheet at Processing.
	Monitor and control all storage areas and conditions.
	Continuous training and coaching of factory employees on Food safety and quality issues.
	Fulfillment of housekeeping and environmental standards.
	Check the packing quality and complete the quality control sheet at the Packing.
	Conduct quality control on pallets in accordance with the finished goods control procedure.
	Ensure daily calibration and verification of all measuring equipment in the laboratory and in the factory.
	Report any non-compliance detected in relation to both the Quality and Food Safety Management Systems to the Quality Manager.
	Report immediately any non-conformity on product quality to the QA manager.
	Report immediately any breakage, damage or malfunction of equipment to the QA manager.
	Ensure samples for analyses are properly taken for each batch.
	Manage and maintain all tools and equipment for conducting quality control checks in both the laboratory and the factory.
	Ensure proper and prompt filing of records: maintain organized and accessible records for analysis and reference.
	Ensure correct traceability of products and records.
	Supporting process improvements throughout the testing and quality assurance processes
	Adhere to all health and safety guidelines in the factory.

	Appraise the performance of immediate team members, identify their training needs and organize or recommend appropriate training for them.

	Knowledge of the use of measuring equipment.
	Knowledge of GMPs
	Knowledge of the HACCP system
	Excellent planning, analytical, and organizational skills
	Ability to work with little or no supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Applications.
	Integrity and accountability
	Fluency in English &ndash; excellent communication skills, both oral and written.

Quality Assurance Officer Job at ReelFruit




        
    

        
        ReelFruit (www.reelfruit.com), founded in 2012, is the market leader in the healthy snack category, pioneering the introduction of healthy dried fruit as a snack in the Nigerian market. The company was founded on a mission to build a scalable agribusiness to add value to the local fruit value chain, produced, package and distribute locally made snacks that could sit on any shelf in the world!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	The ideal candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day implementation and compliance to all product and process specifications, as well as food and environmental safety.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Ensure compliance with quality policy, procedures, work instructions, and documented quality systems. In addition, ensure compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements.
	Carry out inspection upon arrival of raw materials, packaging materials and inputs against specifications and submit reports after inspection.
	Ensure all quality procedures for fruit washing and storage are observed.
	Check the peeling and cutting quality, and complete the quality control sheet at Processing.
	Monitor and control all storage areas and conditions.
	Continuous training and coaching of factory employees on Food safety and quality issues.
	Fulfillment of housekeeping and environmental standards.
	Check the packing quality and complete the quality control sheet at the Packing.
	Conduct quality control on pallets in accordance with the finished goods control procedure.
	Ensure daily calibration and verification of all measuring equipment in the laboratory and in the factory.
	Report any non-compliance detected in relation to both the Quality and Food Safety Management Systems to the Quality Manager.
	Report immediately any non-conformity on product quality to the QA manager.
	Report immediately any breakage, damage or malfunction of equipment to the QA manager.
	Ensure samples for analyses are properly taken for each batch.
	Manage and maintain all tools and equipment for conducting quality control checks in both the laboratory and the factory.
	Ensure proper and prompt filing of records: maintain organized and accessible records for analysis and reference.
	Ensure correct traceability of products and records.
	Supporting process improvements throughout the testing and quality assurance processes
	Adhere to all health and safety guidelines in the factory.


Supervisory duties:


	Appraise the performance of immediate team members, identify their training needs and organize or recommend appropriate training for them.
	Administer disciplinary measures of immediate team members in accordance with the company’s disciplinary procedures
	Interpret policies and procedures to immediate team members and, where necessary, consult a superior or appropriate departments.


Educational Qualifications, Experience & Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree / HND or higher in Food Science, Agribusiness or a related field.
	At least two (2) years of professional or sector/industry experience.
	Flexibility based on the factory production schedule.
	Knowledge of the use of measuring equipment.
	Knowledge of GMPs
	Knowledge of the HACCP system
	Excellent planning, analytical, and organizational skills
	Ability to work with little or no supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Applications.
	Integrity and accountability
	Fluency in English – excellent communication skills, both oral and written.

  "description": "Westfield Consulting Limited -&nbsp;Our client in the Microfinance Banking space is looking for qualified and passionate candidate to fill the position below:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Insurance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: Financial Institution

Job Summary


	Responsible for managing the company&rsquo;s insurance policies, ensuring timely renewals, handling claims, and minimizing risk exposure.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and update all insurance policies.
	Ensure timely renewal of insurance contracts.
	Process and follow up on claims.
	Market insurance to potential clients
	send payment schedule toclients for premium payment
	Liaise with insurance companies and brokers.
	Monitor risk exposure and recommend coverage improvements.


Requirements


	Degree in Insurance, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum 1&ndash;3 years of relevant experience(asrequired).
	Knowledge of insurance policies and claims processes.
	Strong communication and attention to detail.
	MUST have CIIN certification.


Renumeration
